intro: Calligonum × dissectum f. zaissano-muravljanskyi, commonly known as the Zaissano-Muravljanskyi hybrid, is a rare and ornamental plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its unique, deeply lobed leaves that resemble those of its parent species. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually green or yellowish in color. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
